info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 10:21AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE...CLEARFIELD... ELK...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1020 AM EDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of DuBois to near Clearfield to near Philipsburg to 12 miles northwest of State College and moving east at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Black Moshannon State Park around 1025 AM EDT. Julian around 1030 AM EDT. Lecontes Mills around 1040 AM EDT. Pleasant Gap around 1050 AM EDT. Karthaus around 1055 AM EDT. Centre Hall and Pine Glen around 1100 AM EDT. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Woodland and Bellefonte exits, specifically from mile markers 130 to 160. This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 76 to 85. This includes the following highways... Route 219 near Brockport. Route 220 near Bellefonte. State Road 26 from Pleasant Gap to I-80. State Road 153 near Penfield. State Road 255 from Penfield to north of Penfield. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
